medical_history.chief_complaint: Growth Hormone Insensitivity Syndrome (GHIS) with short stature and metabolic abnormalities.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The index patient was first seen at age 47 with short stature noted during evaluation for a toxic thyroid nodule. She has remained euthyroid post-treatment with I-131 and displayed regular menstrual cycles until menopause at age 51.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The index patient has a history of toxic thyroid nodule treated with I-131. Her height is 114 cm, significantly below normal, with a high BMI indicative of obesity. She exhibits insulin resistance, elevated total cholesterol, and high GH levels. The brother has similar phenotypic features.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has a 57-year-old brother with a height of 140 cm presenting with similar short stature and metabolic features. They both have phenotypically normal parents who were deceased. The family comes from a remote region in Teruel, Spain.
